meanings.definition: In a scanty or insufficient manner.
meanings.sent1: She dressed scantily for the cold weather, so she shivered all day.
meanings.sent2: The child ate his dinner scantily, leaving most of it untouched.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to hide his acorns scantily, but they kept rolling away.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone scantily in the night sky, obscured by thick clouds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the lesson scantily, leaving the students confused.

meanings.sent1: The model appeared scantily dressed on the runway, turning heads.
meanings.sent2: During summer, people often choose to dress scantily to stay cool.
meanings.sent3: The superhero fought crime scantily dressed, causing laughter among bystanders.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved gracefully in her scantily adorned costume.
meanings.sent5: The beach was filled with people scantily clad in swimsuits.

meanings.sent1: The scantily filled jar was not enough to last the whole week.
meanings.sent2: The team's performance was scantily satisfactory, needing improvement.
meanings.sent3: The cake was scantily sweet, disappointing the dessert lovers.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was scantily convincing, leaving doubts in our minds.
meanings.sent5: The budget was scantily allocated, causing delays in the project.
